21:00 <mbloom> can anyone help me with a velocity question  
21:01 <mbloom> I’m trying to get the value from a dropdown and use it to set values of a second dropdown  
21:20 <mbloom> sdumitriu: got any insight on this?  
21:21 <sdumitriu> mbloom: Are those HTML dropdowns?  
21:21 <mbloom> yes they are  
21:21 <sdumitriu> On the same page?  
21:22 <sdumitriu> I don't fully understand what you're trying to do  
21:22 <mbloom> sdumitriu: Yes, what I’m trying to do is have one drop down to select a space, and then another to select a page from the space that was selected  
21:22 <sdumitriu> OK  
21:23 <sdumitriu> Well, you can't do it in a simple way, since the HTML lives in the browser, while Velocity is executed on the server  
21:23 <sdumitriu> Two options  
21:23 <sdumitriu> 1. Split it into steps: step 1, select the page, submit, then generate step 2 with Velocity  
21:24 <sdumitriu> 2. Do it with JavaScript, either put all lists of pages for each space somewhere hidden in the HTML, or use an AJAX request to fetch the list of pages from the server  
21:24 <sdumitriu> Which one sounds better?  
21:25 <mbloom> The second using AJAX sounds like the best solution  
21:27 <sdumitriu> http://stackoverflow.com/q/18328871/620249  
21:28 <sdumitriu> The link doesn't point to the right line anymore, but that file has the answer  
21:29 <mbloom> sdumitriu: awesome! thank you for the help
